greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of triples (x,y,z) of nonnegative integers such that x^2+y^3+z^4 = n.
reference: K. B. Ford, The representation of numbers as sums of unlike powers II, J. Amer. Math. Soc., 9 (1996), 919-940.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
maple: for i from 0 to M2 do t0[i]:=0; od:
for a from 0 to M do for b from 0 to M do for c from 0 to M do
i:=a^2+b^3+c^4; if i <= M2 then t0[i]:=t0[i]+1; fi;
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 07 2008
